result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myaka Cornelious Davis

records.addlTxt:
CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10: Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Myaka Cornelious Davis.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Huck. State rest. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 10. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Myaka Cornelious Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel requests more time to review the case. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Myaka Cornelious Davis. Jessica Birmingham appeared under the Student Practice Rule under the supervision of  Prosecuting Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a State V. Lee hearing.  Attorney Kafkas is now the attorney of record. Case is adjourned to 9-16-22 at 8:30 am for Preliminary Hearing in Prelim Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.

Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court or in the alternative that it be set for status of counsel; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with C.A.H
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $6,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No contact monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Myaka Cornelious Davis in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
